title: Former senior Trump officials dined with Ukrainian president's top advisors at Trump hotel
text:
Former senior officials in the Trump administration met with the Ukrainian president's top advisors at one of Trump's hotels in Washington, D.C. just months before the president's now-infamous phone call with Ukraine.

A dinner took place at BLT Prime, inside Trump International Hotel, on April 16 between Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy's closest advisors and former Trump campaign advisor Mike Rubino, along with Matt Mowers, who worked for the State Department.

According to sources familiar with the matter, former White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer also made a brief appearance, but all those involved claim the Bidens were never discussed.

This news comes as President Trump is under fire and facing impeachment after a July phone call with Zelenskiy where he asked for help to dig up dirt on his opponent Joe Biden and his son Hunter.

Former senior officials in the Trump administration met with the Ukrainian president's top advisors on April 16

The dinner took place at BLT Prime, inside Trump International Hotel in Washington, D.C.

According to a lobbying report, Zelensky's campaign hired lobbying firm Signal Group Consulting to set up meetings with government officials for $60,000.

US-based attorney Marcus Cohen helped coordinate private meetings between Washington power players and Zelenskiy's campaign and paid Signal for its services.

According to those with knowledge of the meeting, the focus of the dinner was on the Zelenskiy's campaign, which he won on April 21, and did not lead into a discussion of an investigation into the Bidens.

'Honestly, I think Signal was trying to impress them,' Rubino said in an interview. 'I just did it as a favor. I showed up, sat down, ate dinner and left. I didn't really speak to anybody because they spoke in a different language,'

Rubino added that it was only later that he learned the Ukrainians at the meeting were members of Zelenskiy's team.

Former Trump campaign advisor Mike Rubino, Matt Mowers (right), who worked for the State Department, and Sean Spicer (left) were present

Spicer said he his appearance was brief and added that he was introduced to a member of Zelenskiy's campaign but did not know if it was their organization's leader.

'They introduced me to the campaign guy,' Spicer said in an interview. 'I had every impression that they [Signal] were trying to impress this client.'

A spokesman for Signal told CNBC that there was no discussion about investigating the Bidens at any of their April meetings with Zelenskiy's advisors.

'Signal Group facilitated a number of meetings for Mr. Cohen and the Servant of the People campaign in Washington,' John Procter, the firm's spokesman, said in a statement. 'At no time during the delegation's April visit was there any mention of an investigation of the Biden family or any related topic.'
description: Former senior officials in the Trump administration met with the Ukrainian president's top advisors on April 16. The dinner took place at BLT Prime, inside Trump International Hotel in Washington, D.C.
